reviews.review_msg: Ladislav is the goat

I didn't like paying for Iclicker and webassign, but he did give Amazon gift cards to some students that did Hypatia. I liked his energy. Really helps if you took Calculus 12, because it can  be hard to understand at this pace. To study just do practice problems

he always messed up in lecture but was funny. first and last midterm were okay but second was very hard. don't even get me started on how difficult that final was, thankfully it was only 25% so lock in for the midterms but yeah doesn't know how to teach. nice guy though

Often very hard to follow his lectures. 
He's funny but sometimes hard to understand.
Exams always felt rushed because he would make them wayyy to long.
He seemed nice though...

Dr. Stacho was a mid prof. Lectures were hard to follow. Midterms were based on assignments but were only an hour, and I found that there wasn't enough time to finish them. The final was very difficult. The only things that helped me pass were the Discord server and past exams, which were not provided by Stacho but I found online.

ladislav was hilarious ! he messed up a lot in class but would clarify. despite going to every lecture, i barely paid attention and taught myself outside of class. material isn't hard, attendance isn't mandatory. he's easily approachable and if u do bad on the mt there's around 30% worth of assignments which are easy 100%s. really easy class !

Stacho is a funny guy but not the best prof. His final was quite difficult, midterms were reasonable and mostly based off of the written assignments. His explanations often didn't make sense and he would have trouble pacing his lectures. I would recommend going the the math lab for extra help. Overall he is decent, not terrible and not great.

Great guy and seemed to care about students. Math isn't my best class, and sometimes his teaching was confusing and I easily got lost during his face paced lectures, but there are lots of opportunities to get help in the Math workshop. Overall would take a class with him again.

He was a decent math prof compared to the rest. His lectures were confusing in the beginning but I got a hang of them. His exams are decently fair as well. They are based mainly on his lectures and some online homework basic concepts. If you review the material well and understand it, you will do well even without touching the textbook.
dont fall behind in material and do the homework; the exams are mostly word problems so practice that

He's an alright prof, his lectures were understandable but not engaging- perhaps the energy given by the class is what he gave back as well?As a procrastinator, I highly suggest you review each lecture example after class and try doing them without looking at the answers; if you don't understand any part the TA's do a great job explaining them.
Honestly if I were to describe in him 1 word it would be mid. Because he is exactly that. Not great but not horrible. Lectures are alright and tests aren't to bad either.

I loved his class! Super funny and teaches really well! Really nice prof and tests are really fair as well.. his reviews were very helpful before the midterms and final. He's much better than what he's actually rated as...

I was reluctant to take calc with him from his ratings but after taking math with him, he has become the best prof I've ever had at SFU! His notes are clear, and his lectures are very informative and helpful! He teaches this course excellently and makes great jokes! If you put in the work, you should get a good grade in this class, and he scales!

He hates calc, but doesn't everyone? Dude's hilarious but not for his "jokes" which weren't really jokes most of the time. Accent wasn't bad, English is fine, but he said things really weird sometimes. Extremely fair exams, easy Instructor Questions. Better prof than people make him out to be. :) Super helpful if you go to his office hours. Scales.

I read these reviews before starting the course and was kind of worried but he is very clear in lecture, and provides clear notes and explanations. He does have a strong accent but it is not hard to understand, and he is always trying to get the class laughing and engaged. If you do the assignments that he assigns you'll do fine on the exams.
Took his class a while back. I liked him. His accent is Slovak, not Russian, which was not too hard to understand. Overall, not bad. Super nice guy.

at first he was really hard to understand. once you get by that, he's hilarious in class and is decent at explaining things (not the best). His exams are straight from the homework assignments and notes so study that stuff and you'll be good!

I thought stacho was a great prof! Once you got past his accent hes a good at explaining things. I would recommend his class. His exams are straight up from the homework and notes so i don't understand what people are complaining about. If you study right and pay attention during class, you will do fine.

stop crying people. I failed the 2nd midterm and the final and I still got a C+ in math 154 with stacho. I would recommend him for others just not at the time of 8:30am. His jokes are so funny times. LIke the time he said anyone have questions and held up that stick LOL

Stop blaming Stacho for his teaching methods! At least %80 of final exam questions was straight from his lecture notes and weekly assignment. He even scaled at the end. good times at high school is over guys. build a proper schedule, and study hard if you want good grades. Be competitive and don't blame others.

Very boring class; if you've taken calculus in high school, it will be painful to sit through his lectures (I skipped the last 3 weeks). If you can learn from the textbook, do it, and use the calc workshop for support. Your peers and the TA's will be the best help. Stacho though truly is a nice guy, he's just not the best teacher.

Hes not a good professor for someone who wants to succeed. He doesnt care for students success, he wants to do his job and leave asap. He skips steps in his notes, which defeats the purpose of going to class, and notes are copied from the textbook. I went to Nadia's class and learned one concept in 10 mins that would take me 2 weeks in his class.

Stacho's AWESOME! His exams are a cakewalk. Seriously, easiest prof ever. Questions are usually straight out of the textbook, or from examples. His communication could use some improvement, but he clearly tries hard to ensure everyone is learning. Good job Stacho :)

if u can read the book and learn from the book then you will do well in the course. stacho is not good at teaching. he skips alot of steps when he solves a problem and makes a mistake at times so it makes it hard to follow. i would suggest taking 154 with nadia nosrati. she is stachos student. most people from stachos class attend nadias

Honestly, not the best prof in the world. Not because of his accent, not because he's a jerk (because I really think he is a nice man, and can be quite funny at times!), but because he tends to go through his examples way too quickly, without actually teaching them. Just remember to clarify your answers on all assignments, midterms, and the final!

I love him to pieces! He is very straight forward, yes does read off the notes, but embellishes very well. His amazing Russian accent only adds to the class, yeah? The exams were very fair, and would recommend him for any student.

Watch out people. This prof is really bad. Study the assignments, practice questions. Stacho rambles on and on in class, and doesn't know what he's saying. He makes so many mistakes in his calculations, and the second midterm we got had a FAIL average. Wonder what the final exam average will be...

This is the worst prof of my whole entire existence! I do not like to hate on people, but he is just a dissaster and a half! Once again... worst prof ever!!! He doesn't explain anything, just reads what it says on the notes. His exams were extremely hard and were not relavent to what he said to study or what he taught.The class average was a fail!

At first I thought he was an alright prof. His notes are somewhat useless and he skips important examples. The first midterm was alright, but his second midterm killed the class. It was all on concept and there was only 2 questions with a total of 10 on a 40 question test that were actually from the assignments.
Extremely hard to understand. Overhead notes are impossible to read if you dont sit in the front of the 400+ person class.
Oh my gosh.  I love him.  He is so adorable, I love his accent, it's so adorable, and I love how he makes jokes sometimes.  Just study (like any other class) and you'll do well. :)
He's a nice guy, but he needs to know how to teach before being a professor.. Even one of the TA teaches better than him.. geezz!
